LongDescription: By removing most of the high-power components and reflective drive housing, this drive greatly reduces the warship's radar signature at the cost of a significant decrease in speed and reduced drive durability.
FlavorText:
You don't usually see these, at least not on frontline warships. From what I found in the old Naval Office documents, these were supplied to a line of now-mothballed Raines variants that haunted the Eight Ball Belt to weed out the pirate problem. Evidently, that worked out pretty well.

But the actual engine crew will give you a look if you so much as think about complimenting the drive. Since the Naval Office took off the protective housing, a good shake will make the entire drive switch into a shutdown state and blare the loudest alarm you've ever heard. I definitely don't miss working on these.

- I. Parker, CMC
FormattedBuffs:
Top Speed: <color=#FF2525>-15%</color>
Radar Signature: <color=#4CFF72>-25%</color>
Linear Thrust: <color=#FF2525>-25%</color>
